title: Chittoor district targets 50% green cover by 2047 under Mission Haritha Andhra Pradesh

title: Prosumers in Kerala slam draft renewable energy regulations at physical hearing held by Kerala State Electricity Regulatory Commission
content: The draft regulations contained proposals for restricting the Net Metering System to 3 kW, imposing a ‘grid support charge’ of ₹1 for every unit of renewable energy exported to the grid and certain conditions related to battery storage

title: Veteran space scientist Eknath Vasant Chitnis dies at 100

title: Karnataka State Travel Operators Association urges Finance Ministry to include mid-sized vehicles under GST 2.0 concessions

title: From ruin to recovery: How a parasitic wasp saved South India’s tapioca crops
content: Cassava, better known as tapioca, is grown on about 1.73 lakh hectares in India, with Tamil Nadu and Kerala together contributing more than 90% of total production. Before the outbreak, yields averaged 35 tonnes per hectare, far above the global average of 10.76 tonnes

title: Sony Music refuses to share with Ilaiyaraaja details of revenue earned by ‘exploiting’ his songs

title: Mangling Chennai’s street names and distorting history
content: Rajachar Street in T. Nagar is spelt in three different ways on the signboards of the Chennai Corporation. The street is named after S.N.V. Rajachar who served as the Chief Presidency Magistrate in Madras.

title: How Janaki Ramachandran became the Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu after MGR’s demise

title: How a rattled Jayalalithaa tackled Vijayakant’s political reach
content: In 2011, Jayalalithaa tied up with Vijayakant’s DMDK to take on the ruling DMK. However, in February 2012, the AIADMK leader snapped relations with the DMDK following a showdown with Vijayakant in the Assembly.

title: Tamil Nadu government reiterates purchase preference for SC/ST-owned firms while floating tenders
content: The State government had enabled the mandatory purchase preference for enterprises owned by entrepreneurs from SC and ST communities under certain provisions of the Tamil Nadu Transparency in Tenders Act, 1998, and Rules, 2000

title: U.P. CM announces age relaxation, reservation for Agniveers in police
content: Agniveers retiring in 2026 and beyond will receive an age relaxation and horizontal reservation, on par with ex-servicemen, in direct recruitment to the ranks of Constable, Mounted Constable, and Fireman

title: Mehul Choksi Complained About Indian Jails. See Where He Will Be Imprisoned
content: Fugitive diamond merchant Mehul Choksi has suffered a big setback in his plea against extradition to India. A Belgium court has said there are no legal barriers and the charges against him were serious enough to justify it.

title: Trump's Call To Freeze Current Frontlines "Good Compromise": Zelensky
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said Wednesday he backed US President Donald Trump's proposal that the current front line should be the basis for negotiations with Russia, but said he doubted President Vladimir Putin would accept it.

title: Delhi Teen Shoots At Friend's Grandfather Over Property Dispute, Detained
content: A teenage boy was apprehended for allegedly opening fire at another boy's 75-year-old grandfather over a long-standing property dispute in central Delhi's Chandni Mahal area, police said on Wednesday.

title: Cook On Karnataka Government Contract Suspended For Attending RSS Event
content: A cook at a Karnataka hostel was suspended over his participation in a Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) event.

title: Woman Kills 65-Year-Old Bihar Man With Sword After Argument Over Samosa
content: A 65-year-old farmer in Bihar has been murdered after a dispute broke out over a samosa. The accused woman is on the run.

title: Woman Doctor Assaulted, Threatened With Rape At Bengal Hospital, 3 Arrested
content: Three people have been arrested in West Bengal's Uluberia for allegedly assaulting a woman doctor at a state-run hospital and threatening her with rape

title: Louvre Robbers' "Dhoom"-Style Escape On Scooters. AI Video Goes Viral
content: The Louvre in Paris reopened for visitors on Wednesday morning, three days after it was shuttered following an audacious daylight heist where thieves fled with precious royal jewellery worth over $100 million in just seven minutes.

title: Congress Leader's "Surname" Charge Over Sarfaraz Khan Snub And A Gambhir Dig

content: According to the Congress leader, the corporation is struggling to break even and urged the government to release the pending funds.

content: Flight UA1093, flying from Denver to Los Angeles, was carrying 134 passengers and six crew members when a loud impact startled those on board.

title: What Is ChatGPT Atlas, OpenAI's AI-Powered "Super-Assistant" Web Browser
content: Atlas is a web browser with ChatGPT embedded throughout, allowing users to interact with the AI assistant directly on any webpage.

title: Finding Jewels And Brazen Thieves In Louvre Heist Is A Race Against Time
content: The glittering sapphires, emeralds, and diamonds that once adorned France's royals could well be gone forever, experts say after a brazen, 4-minute heist in broad daylight left the nation stunned and the government struggling to explain a new debacle

title: Chhath Puja To Be Performed At 1,500 Ghats Across Delhi
content: The Delhi BJP on Wednesday said this year's Chhath Puja celebrations will be organised at around 1,500 ghats across the city.

content: The Canadian foreign minister's visit to India turned the page from the lowest point of crisis to a new chapter of pragmatism. However, the depth of future cooperation will be determined by the political will to manage the sensitive security file qui

title: Japan's New PM To Woo Trump With Pickups And Soybeans
content: As Japan's new premier Sanae Takaichi got to work on Wednesday, her government began finalising a purchase package, including US pickups, soybeans and gas, to present to President Donald Trump in trade and security talks next week, two sources said.

title: Explained: 350 vs 1,100, CPCB vs IQAir, Who Has Got Delhi's AQI Right
content: Both CPCB and IQAir follow different methods of calculating air quality index, resulting in different numbers.

title: Sri Lankan Politician Assassinated In Office, Gunman Fired Multiple Shots
content: Lasantha Wickramasekara, 38, the council chairman of the coastal city of Weligama, was meeting with constituents when a gunman burst in and fired multiple times with a revolver.

title: Video: BMW Crashes Inside Mumbai's Coastal Road Tunnel, Traffic Affected
content: A speeding BMW car overturned inside a tunnel of Mumbai's Coastal Road, slowing down traffic for a while, officials said on Wednesday.

title: Punjab Saw Dip In Farm Fires Incident From September 15-October 21: Data
content: Punjab recorded 415 farm fire incidents between September 15 and October 21 this year, down from 1,510 incidents during the same period last year, data showed.

title: 'Stealth Husband' Of Japan's New PM Sanae Takaichi Vows Quiet Support
content: The spouse of Japan's first woman Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi hopes to support her by being a "stealth husband", cooking meals but staying out of the spotlight.

title: 'If you want trophy': New twist in Asia Cup row; Naqvi sends stern message to BCCI
content: A dispute has erupted between the BCCI and PCB over the Asia Cup trophy presentation. PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi insists on personally handing the trophy to India in Dubai on November 10, following India's refusal to accept it from him after their win. This stems from tensions between the Indian team and the ACC president.

title: 'Not even Magnus Carlsen': How Norway Chess did what Freestyle couldn't - exclusive
content: In a twist that’s shaken up the global chess scene, Norway Chess has pulled off what even Magnus Carlsen’s Freestyle tour couldn’t, convincing FIDE to approve a brand-new World Championship title. The “Total Chess World Championship” marks a stunning power play that could redefine how elite chess is played and governed.

title: Microsoft's new RTO policy: Allows work from home for these roles; sends memo to employees
content: Microsoft is reportedly exempting some client-facing sales and solution engineering roles from its upcoming return-to-office mandate, signaling a more flexible approach. This decision acknowledges the unique demands of these positions, contrasting with a broader industry trend of scaling back remote work options. The company emphasizes its commitment to flexibility where it is practical.

title: Big changes in IT Rules soon? Centre mulls tweaks - AI, deepfakes in focus
content: India's IT ministry is proposing new rules to combat AI-generated deepfakes and synthetic content. Social media giants with over 50 lakh users must identify and label artificial content, ensuring users can distinguish it from reality. These measures aim to boost accountability and user awareness amidst growing concerns over AI misuse.

title: IPL trade: Ishan Kishan returning home? Lot of interest for wicketkeeper-batter
content: Ishan Kishan is attracting interest from multiple IPL franchises ahead of the mini-auction, with Mumbai Indians leading the chase to bring the wicketkeeper-batter back. Despite a mixed spell at SRH, Kishan’s strong Ranji form and past success with MI make him a valuable top-order option. Talks hinge on SRH’s willingness and Kishan’s own decision to move.

title: Watch: Shots fired outside Serbian parliament; President calls it 'terrorist attack'
content: Shots were fired outside Serbia's parliament in Belgrade, injuring one person and prompting President Aleksandar Vucic to label it a "terrorist attack." A video captured security officers near a tent, followed by gunfire and a fire. The injured man is in stable condition, and authorities are investigating the incident.

title: How OpenAI's Sam Altman may have just delivered 'Diwali gift' to Google CEO Sundar Pichai
content: OpenAI's new ChatGPT Atlas browser is a surprise boon for Google.  The launch strengthens Google's argument that AI chatbots already challenge its search business.  This development helps Google avoid a potential breakup of its Chrome browser.  A judge recently cited AI like ChatGPT as a significant competitive threat to Google's market position.

title: Stephen A Smith’s bold take: Dak Prescott, Cowboys won’t win NFC East title
content: Despite Dak Prescott's strong offensive performance, Stephen A. Smith expressed doubt about the Dallas Cowboys winning the NFC East, citing their historically bad defense. Smith highlighted the team's league-worst defensive statistics, arguing that offensive prowess alone cannot overcome these significant flaws. The Cowboys face a crucial test against the Denver Broncos.

title: Donald Trump's AI czar David Sacks calls Anthropic 'woke'; CEO Dario Amodei responds
content: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei has countered claims of a "Woke" stance, asserting alignment with the Trump administration on key AI policy.  This follows criticism from AI czar David Sacks, who accused the company of "regulatory capture." Amodei emphasised a unified federal approach to AI development, aiming to benefit Americans and secure the nation's lead.

title: ‘Kantara: Chapter 1’ BO collection day 21 - Rishab Shetty-starrer crosses Rs 550 cr mark
content: Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1' is a box office sensation, crossing ₹550 crore in India three weeks post-release. Its strong performance through Diwali, with significant earnings daily, highlights its pan-India appeal beyond Karnataka. The film's universal themes resonate widely, impacting its OTT release date, which is now uncertain due to continued theatrical success.

title: Delhi had a blast: In Karol Bagh, it was a scream! Stations exceeded standard decibel levels
content: Delhi's Diwali festivities ringing in this year brought an unexpected surge of noise, with several monitoring stations recording decibel levels well beyond what is legally acceptable. Even with a green cracker initiative and allotted hours for bursting, the decibel meter was pushed to its limits, particularly from 9 pm until 11 pm, spilling over into the night across many regions.

title: Yogi Adityanath defends Halal ban; says ended Eid milan tradition at CM house
content: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath defended the state's ban on Halal-certified products, alleging funds were misused for terrorism, 'love jihad,' and conversions. He stated these certifications operate as an unregulated system, earning significant amounts without official recognition. Adityanath also discussed the secularization of official events, emphasizing inclusivity beyond religious celebrations.

title: Delhi air pollution: At peak hours, data goes blank at many stations
content: Air quality monitoring stations in Delhi experienced significant data gaps during peak pollution hours, with several stations going offline when PM2.5 and PM10 levels neared 1,000 µg/m³. Experts allege this skews 24-hour averages and hinders understanding of pollution's impact. Authorities, however, deny any missing data.

title: Watch: Disturbed by firecrackers, stray dog boards metro in Kolkata
content: Caught on camera during the festivities of Diwali, a stray dog’s unexpected ride on the Kolkata Metro has melted hearts online. Seeking refuge from bursting fireworks, the canine commuter wandered through compartments in search of calm, winning over every commuter along the way. Watch the touching moment that’s reminding everyone what compassion looks like this Diwali.

title: Are Fortnite servers not responding? How to fix on PS5, PC and Xbox
content: Fortnite players facing server connection problems can find solutions here. The article outlines common reasons for outages, including Epic Games maintenance and network issues. It provides step-by-step fixes for PS5, PC, and Xbox users. Simple restarts, checking internet connections, and reinstalling the game are suggested. Players are advised to be patient during updates as issues often resolve quickly.

title: 'Tufat al-Muminat': JeM launches online 'jihadi course' for women; will charge PKR 500
content: Pakistan-based Jaish-e-Mohammed has launched an online training course, 'Tufat al-Muminat,' led by Masood Azhar's sister, to recruit women and raise funds. This initiative, following the formation of its women's wing, signals a strategic shift, potentially involving female suicide attackers. The group continues to operate and solicit donations openly, despite international scrutiny.

title: Eknath Chitnis passes away: Isro pioneer was 100; built India’s first telecom satellite
content: Isro scientist Dr Eknath Chitnis has passed away at the age of 100. He was a foundational figure at the Indian Space Research Organisation. Dr Chitnis worked with Dr Homi Bhabha in the early days. He was instrumental in developing India's first telecommunication satellite, INSAT. This satellite advanced the nation's space communication capabilities.

title: IND vs AUS: Why India will level ODI series in Adelaide - here are the numbers
content: India faces a crucial second ODI against Australia at Adelaide, needing a series-saving performance from veterans Kohli and Sharma after their Perth defeat. The team grapples with the absence of Pandya and the Adelaide pitch's expected challenges. Australia welcomes back Zampa and Carey, while India ponders bowling options amid batting concerns.

title: Watch: Neeraj Chopra conferred honorary rank of Lt Colonel in Army
content: Olympic champion Neeraj Chopra has been appointed Lieutenant Colonel (Honorary) in the Indian Army. This honour follows his distinguished military career and numerous athletic achievements. Chopra's journey includes significant awards like the Arjuna Award, Khel Ratna, and Padma Shri. His recent participation in the World Athletics Championships also saw him compete strongly.

title: Louvre heist: Museum reopens 3 days after jewellery heist
content: The Louvre reopened after a three-day closure due to the theft of royal jewels. The Apollo Gallery remains shut following a daylight heist where thieves used an extendable ladder and power tools to steal eight priceless pieces. The incident highlights ongoing security upgrade delays and concerns about the museum's obsolescence.

title: Why global apps showed Delhi’s AQI levels at 2,000+, but CPCB under 400
content: Delhi residents were confused by vastly different pollution readings on Tuesday. While India's CPCB showed AQI below 400, international apps like IQAir reported over 2,000. Experts explain these discrepancies stem from different calculation methods and data sources, though both indicate dangerously poor air quality post-Diwali.

title: Kiran Mazumdar offers money to fix Bengaluru roads; Chidambaram says problem is execution
content: Biocon chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw has offered to fund repairs for Bengaluru's damaged roads, prompting a proposal from P Chidambaram for industry to supervise public works. This initiative aims to improve project execution and accountability, addressing the city's persistent infrastructure issues amid public frustration.

title: 'I have been critical of Modi because ... ' : Zohran Mamdani attends Diwali event in New York
content: New York State Assembly member Zohran Mamdani has drawn controversy for criticizing Prime Minister Narendra Modi's vision of India, stating it lacks room for all citizens. Mamdani, running for New York City mayor, emphasizes his campaign's commitment to pluralism and representing all New Yorkers, regardless of their views on Modi.

title: Gold and silver rate outlook: Where are prices headed after Diwali rally fizzles?
content: Gold and silver prices are experiencing a temporary correction after a significant rally, with experts predicting a strong long-term outlook. Despite recent dips, global demand, central bank buying, and geopolitical factors are expected to support further price increases for gold. Silver also saw a substantial rise and may consolidate before resuming an upward trend.

title: 'Want to be nice to China': Trump amid 155% glooming tariffs
content: President Trump expressed a desire for amicable relations with China but criticized the nation's past trade practices, attributing them to a lack of business acumen in previous US leadership. He highlighted significant tariff revenues, suggesting potential distributions to citizens. Trump also indicated India has reduced Russian oil purchases, aligning with his desire for peace in Ukraine. A potential trade deal with China is anticipated at the upcoming APEC summit.

title: Trump pressured Zelenskyy to give up eastern Donbas in 'tense' meeting
content: A senior Ukrainian official revealed that President Trump urged President Zelenskyy to cede the Donbas region to Russia for peace during a tense meeting. Trump reportedly echoed Putin's talking points, warning Zelenskyy of annihilation if a deal wasn't struck. Zelenskyy left the White House without securing commitments, facing pressure for territorial concessions.

title: Lucknow: Elderly Dalit man forced to lick ground after 'accidentally unrinating' near temple
content: An elderly Dalit man was allegedly forced to lick the ground near a Lucknow temple on Diwali after being accused of urinating there. The victim's family states it was an accident due to his breathing difficulties. Police have arrested the accused, Swami Kant, and are investigating the incident, which has sparked political outrage.

title: 'I got very angry': Trump reacts to being rated third-best US President
content: President Donald Trump expressed significant anger after being ranked third on a "Presidential Walk of Fame," placing him behind George Washington and Abraham Lincoln.  He lamented the ranking, stating it was "less than great." Trump acknowledged the difficulty of surpassing the historical figures but vowed to try, humorously noting his administration's involvement in numerous wars.

title: 'Vile degradation': Trump ally shocked to discover MAGA's anti-India rhetoric
content: For once, D’Souza didn’t hit back. He seemed shaken. “In a career spanning forty years,” he wrote later, “I have never encountered this type of rhetoric. The Right never used to talk like this. So who on our side has legitimised this type of vile degradation?”

title: 'Activate your embassy in Kabul': Taliban urges US to reopen mission; seeks trade, ties
content: The Taliban's interim government in Afghanistan has expressed a desire for good economic and political ties with the US, urging Washington to reopen its embassy in Kabul instead of focusing on Bagram Airbase. This comes as India has upgraded its technical mission in Kabul to a full embassy, signaling strengthened bilateral engagement.

title: Hardik Pandya comeback: Cricketer to spend four weeks at BCCI's CoE
content: Hardik Pandya is undergoing a four-week rehabilitation at the BCCI Centre of Excellence in Bengaluru for his quadriceps injury, with no surgery required. He is expected to be fit for the upcoming white-ball series against South Africa, aiming for complete match fitness after picking up the injury during the Asia Cup.

title: Popular Punjabi singer Teji Kahlon shot at in Canada: Bullets pumped into stomach
content: Punjabi singer Teji Kahlon was shot in Canada by associates of gangster Rohit Godara, who claimed Kahlon supplied weapons and money to rival gangs and acted as an informant. This incident highlights an ongoing transnational gang feud, following the recent murder of businessman Ramesh Rulania in Rajasthan, also suspected to be linked to Godara's gang.

title: Delhi air pollution: Worst Diwali air in 4 years, Tuesday winds prevent ‘severe’ drop
content: Delhi's air quality plunged into the 'very poor' category on Diwali night as firecracker violations surged, pushing PM2.5 levels to their highest since 2021. Despite a temporary spike, rising winds and warmer temperatures prevented a prolonged severe episode. Authorities are monitoring the situation, with Stage III of GRAP not yet invoked.

title: Air India Newark flight makes emergency return to Mumbai; technical issue suspected
content: An Air India flight from Mumbai to Newark made a safe return to Mumbai due to a suspected technical problem. This incident caused the cancellation of both the outbound and inbound flights. Air India is assisting affected passengers with hotel stays and rebooking them on alternative flights to ensure they reach their destinations.

title: Who is Francesca Orsini, JNU and London University scholar denied entry at Delhi airport?
content: Professor Francesca Orsini, a UK-based scholar of Hindi and Urdu literature at SOAS, University of London, was recently deported from Delhi’s Indira Gandhi International Airport over alleged visa violations. Holding a PhD from SOAS and a BA in Hindi from Venice University, Orsini has studied in India and taught at Cambridge. A Fellow of the British Academy, she specialises in multilingual literary cultures of South Asia and has authored several acclaimed academic works.

title: Chopper scare: President Murmu’s helicopter wheels sink into landing pad in Kerala
content: During her visit to Kerala, President Droupadi Murmu encountered a small mishap as her helicopter touched down on a helipad that unexpectedly sank. However, swift measures from the authorities ensured her well-being. Over the next four days, her agenda features a prominent pilgrimage to the revered Sabarimala temple, alongside several inaugural ceremonies and centenary festivities throughout the region.

title: Liver damage warning signs visible on your hands; here’s what you need to know
content: Your hands can offer early warnings of liver trouble. Look for red palms, changes in nails like brittleness or white tips, and persistent itching. These subtle signs, including tremors and bent fingers, may point to conditions like fatty liver or cirrhosis. Prompt medical attention for these hand symptoms is crucial for effective management and preventing serious liver disease.

title: Fortnite v37.51 Update: Downtime schedule and start time by region
content: Fortnite is undergoing routine server maintenance starting at 4 AM ET, with downtime expected to last a few hours. This update will introduce new content, including cosmetics and potential gameplay adjustments, to keep the game fresh. Players are advised to complete in-game tasks beforehand and monitor official channels for updates.

title: WH diwali party: Trump mispronounces names of Indian-Americans leaders - watch
content: During a White House Diwali celebration, President Trump's attempts to greet Indian-American leaders and dignitaries were marked by several mispronunciations of their names. This follows a pattern of the former president struggling with names and words, both domestically and internationally, often leading to public amusement.

title: Gold rate today: Yellow metal rebounds, global prices at $4,146
content: Gold prices saw a slight increase on Wednesday. This followed a significant drop the previous day. Investors are now keenly observing US inflation figures. These numbers will offer clues about the Federal Reserve's future interest rate decisions. The market is anticipating potential buying opportunities after the recent price decline.

title: Where Dodgers-Blue Jays ranks among best World Series matchups since 2000
content: Los Angeles Dodgers and the Toronto Blue Jays will have an epic World Series . none of the past five World Series went longer than six games . the blue Jays are hoping to become the first repeat champion in 25 years .
